name: monitor and control ground floor hue bridge
monitor and control basement hue bridge
send timer events
info:
Send timer events over the course of each day:

1. Once at start up
2. At the start of each time of day as calculated by the `function` node
   named `time`

Each such message will have `msg.topic` set to `timer/time` and
`msg.payload` set to one of the _time_ values:

- `morning`
- `midday`
- `afternoon`
- `evening`
- `night`

Again, see the documentation for the `function` node named `time` for
more details.

name: send daily events
info:
Send daily events:

1. Once at start up
2. Each time a user changes the value of the _Bedtime_ dashboard
   control
3. Every morning at 1:01AM

The events sent periodically by this group of nodes are:

| `msg.topic`        | `msg.payload`                                                                                             | Description                                                                           |
|--------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `settings/bedtime` | Value selected by a user using the _Bedtime_ control on the dashboard                                     | Approximate hour at which "night mode" should begin each day                          |
| `daily/theme`      | The _theme_string for the current day                                                                     | See the information for the `function` node named `theme` for more details            |
| `daily/sunrise`    | Timestamp at which the sun rises on the current day                                                       | See the information for the `function` node named `sunrise | sunset` for more details |
| `daily/sunset`     | Timestamp at which the sun sets on the current day                                                        | See the information for the `function` node named `sunrise | sunset` for more details |
| `daily/bedtime`    | A timestamp that varies slightly each day, based on the value of the most recent `settings/bedtime` event | See the information for the `function` node named `bedtime` for more details          |

**Note:** All three of the `function` nodes, `theme`, `sunrise | sunset`
and `bedtime`, are downstream of a `join` node even though only one
of them (`bedtime`) directly depends on both inputs to the `join`. This
is deliberate. Blocking the `theme` and `sunrise | sunset` functions
until after at least one message has been received from a `mqtt in`
node ensures that they will not attempt to send messages before the
connection to the MQTT broker is ready. This assumes that all of the
`mqtt in` and `mqtt out` nodes on this flow use the same broker
configuration node.

The alternative would be to add a `status` node for the relevant
`mqtt out` node and another `join` node to synchronize the `function`
nodes with the connection state.

discovered by querying a _PowerView_ hub.

format event
func:
// clear out cached resources
flow.set('resources', {})

const updates = [{ type: 'update', data: msg.payload }]
const event = { type: 'message', data: JSON.stringify(updates) }

msg.payload = event
msg.topic = 'message'

return msg

name: persist error
func:
const date = new Date()
const error = global.get('error', 'file') || { count: 0 }

error.timestamp = date.getTime()
error.localeString = date.toLocaleString()
error.count += 1
error.latest = RED.util.cloneMessage(msg)
global.set('error', error, 'file')
return msg

info:
Subscribe to `settings/bedtime` messages from the MQTT broker. See the
documentation for the _Bedtime_ dashboard control for more information.

Send the current timestamp:

1. At start up
2. Each morning at 1:01AM

Synchronize receipt of `daily/timestamp` and `settings/bedtime`
messages.

name: theme
info:
Set `msg.payload` to one of the _theme_ values, described below, and
`msg.topic` to `daily/theme`.

_Note that this `function` node is placed downstream of a `join` in
order to delay sending MQTT messages until after the connection to the
broker has been established; the only input data on which this function
actually relies comes from the `inject` node which fires once when
flows start and then every morning at 1AM._

# Input

- timestamp in `msg.payload.daily`
- all other `msg` properties are ignored

# Output

- `msg.topic` set to `daily/theme`
- `msg.payload` set to one of the following strings, based on the
  the timestamp from the input:

| `msg.payload` | Description         |
|---------------|---------------------|
| `tribal`      | July 1 - 4          |
| `spooky`      | Any day in October  |
| `jolly`       | Any day in December |
| `standard`    | Any other day       |

name: sunrise | sunset
info:
Use the [suncalc](https://www.npmjs.com/package/suncalc) package to
obtain the times at which the sun rises and sets on a given day.

_Note that this `function` node is placed downstream of a `join` in
order to delay sending MQTT messages until after the connection to the
broker has been established; the only input data on which this function
actually relies comes from the `inject` node which fires once when
flows start and then every morning at 1AM._

_Note also that this assumes:_

_- `function` nodes are allowed to dynamically load the_ suncalc
   _package_

_- `${LATITUDE}` and `${LONGITUDE}` environment variables contain the
  georgraphical coordinates to pass to `suncalc.getTimes()`_

# Input

- timestamp in `msg.payload.daily`
- all other `msg` properties are ignored

# Output

1. sunrise
   - `msg.payload` is the timestamp for sunrise as reported by _suncalc_
   - `msg.topic` is `daily/sunrise`
2. sunset
   - `msg.payload` is the timestamp for sunset as reported by _suncalc_
   - `msg.topic` is `daily/sunset`

name: bedtime
info:
Calculate a slightly randomized timestamp based on the values of
`msg.payload.daily` and `msg.payload.settings/bedtime` as described
below.

# Input
 
 - timestamp for the current day in `msg.payload.daily`
 - value from the `Bedtime` dashboard control in
   `msg.payload.settings/bedtime`
- all other `msg` properties are ignored

# Output

- `msg.topic` set to `daily/bedtime`
- `msg.payload` set to a timestamp as described below

# Details

This `function` node receives input from a `join` node that combines the
timestamp for a given day with a value selected by use of a dropdown
control on the dashboard. It calculates a random offset of plus or minus
30 minutes, adds that to the hour specified by the received value in
`msg.payload.settings/bedtime` and calculates the timestamp for that
hour on the day specified by the value received in `msg.payload.daily`,
placing it in `msg.payload` in the output message.

name: daily/+
info:
Broadcast daily event messages using MQTT based on the values of their
`msg.payload` and `msg.topic` properties.

func: rbe
info:
Block messages unless `msg.payload` changes, treating each `msg.topic`
independently.

Send the output of the `function` node named `time` as a `timer/time`
event using MQTT.

name: time
info:
Use the [suncalc](https://www.npmjs.com/package/suncalc) package to
calculate a _time_ value, described below, based on the position of
the sun.

_Note that this assumes:_

_- `function` nodes are allowed to dynamically load the_ suncalc
   _package_

_- `${LATITUDE}` and `${LONGITUDE}` environment variables contain the
  georgraphical coordinates to pass to `suncalc.getPosition()`_

# Input

- timestamp for current minute in `msg.payload.now`
- timestamp for sunrise in `msg.payload.daily/sunrise`
- timestamp for sunset in `msg.payload.daily/sunset`
- timestamp for bedtime in `msg.payload.daily/bedtime`
- all other `msg` properties are ignored

_See the documentation for the `function` node named `bedtime` for
information on how `msg.payload.daily/bedtime` is calculated._

# Output

- `msg.topic` is `timer/time`
- `msg.payload` is one of the following strings:

| `msg.payload` | Description                                                                                                                                                             |
|---------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `morning`     | Sunrise to the time at which either the sun is high enough so as not to shine directly into any windows or the sun is no longer shining on the eastern side of the home |
| `midday`      | Time during which the sun is high enough so as not to shine directly into any windows                                                                                   |
| `afternoon`   | Time at which the sun is shining on the western side of the home and low enough to shine directly into windows                                                          |
| `evening`     | Sunset to bedtime                                                                                                                                                       |
| `night`       | Bedtime to sunrise of the next day                                                                                                                                      |

# Details

The "time at which the is high enough so as not to shine directly into
any windows" is determined empirically for a home based on its location,
elevation, orientation, size of awnings or roof overhang and so on.
Based on that value and the values of `${LATITUDE}` and `${LONGITUDE}`,
the sun may not reach such a height on any given day. No messages with
`msg.payload` set to `midday` will be sent on such occasions.

Similarly, this function assumes that sunrise and sunset will occur
on the same day and that both will always precede bedtime. These
assumptions might be violated at certain times of year for extreme
values of `${LATITUDE}`.
Synchronize the daily events with the ones sent every minute.

func: rbe
info:
Block messages unless `msg.payload` changes, treating each `msg.topic`
independently.
Subscribe to all of the daily event messages sent via MQTT.

Send a message:

1. At start up
2. Every 60 seconds thereafter

Each such message will have `msg.payload` set to the timestamp for the
moment it was sent and `msg.topic` set to `now`.

`msg.topic`.

name: stringify payload
func:
msg.time = new Date().toLocaleString()
msg.payload = JSON.stringify(msg.payload, undefined, 1)
return msg

name: split by address
request key
info:
Set `msg.url` and `msg.payload` to use as the parameters in a command to
register a user name with a Hue Bridge.

See
<https://developers.meethue.com/develop/hue-api-v2/getting-started/>
for more information.

Send a HTTP `POST` request using TLS but without certificate validation
due to defects in the Hue Bridge API.

name: persist hue key
func:
const hueKey = global.get('hue-key', 'file') || {}

hueKey[msg.topic] = msg.payload
global.set('hue-key', hueKey, 'file')
return msg

name: hue bridges
format: {{bridge.id}} {{bridge.name}} {{bridge.host}} {{bridge.address}} {{bridge.port}} Create Key
